description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to take their Excel skills to the next level.
descriptionMD: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to take their Excel skills to the next level.
name: Excel 2016 Advanced
subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: Excel 2016 Advanced explores ways to enhance Excel workbooks with topics in analyzing data, collaborating and workbook security, and adding graphical elements. This series covers important Excel functionality such as format as table, conditional formatting, shared workbooks and tracked changes, and data validation. While Excel 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Excel 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to take their Excel skills to the next level.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to analyze data using sort and filter functions in Excel 2016. Sorting changes the order of all your data either by date, price, or alphabetically. Filter shows data based on your criteria. They also explore more advanced techniques with custom sorts and custom filters.
episodes.title: Sort and Filter

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne will explore conditional formatting which allows you to automatically apply formats to a cell or range of cells based on cell values. They demonstrate the different types of rules and how to customize formatting.
episodes.title: Conditional Formatting

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using outline and subtotals in Excel 2016. Here you will learn how to work with outlines to create collapsible groups of rows and columns to show/hide your data as well as add calculated subtotals to properly sorted ranges.
episodes.title: Outline and Subtotals

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne examine working with data formatted as tables in Excel 2016. Here they will cover table formatting options, adding/deleting table rows/columns, adding a total row, removing duplicates, and converting to a range.
episodes.title: Tables

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover data tables, part of the What-If Analysis tools. Data tables can show different results of formulas by changing up to two variables.
episodes.title: Data Tables

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss combining and summarizing data using the consolidate command. This can be used within a single worksheet or across multiple worksheets and/or workbooks.
episodes.title: Consolidate Data

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach examine scenarios in the What-If Analysis commands. Scenarios allow you to set up and save different values in cells and see how they can create different results in your formulas.
episodes.title: Scenarios

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach cover the last item in the What-If Analysis tool group - goal seek. Goal seek is used when you know the desired result of your formulas, but want to experiment with cell values to achieve that result.
episodes.title: Goal Seek

episodes.description: Vonne and Zach discuss how to remove duplicate data in three different ways:  using the remove duplicate command, conditional formatting, and advanced filters.
episodes.title: Remove Duplicates

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Zach take a deeper dive into advanced filter options.
episodes.title: Advanced Filter

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne show you how to add a graphical element to your Excel 2016 spreadsheets. Here they will demonstrate inserting graphics from a file or online, as well as resizing, rotating, aligning, moving, and cropping your images.
episodes.title: Image: Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive deeper into working with graphics inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to manipulate images by adding borders, effects, change picture styles, reset pictures, perform image corrections, add artistic effects, and add alternate text titles and descriptions for accessibility.
episodes.title: Images: Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne look at inserting and formatting shapes in Excel 2016. They demonstrate how to manipulate shapes by resizing, rotating, filling with gradients/colors, connecting shapes with lines, adding text, and editing their points.
episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne continue working with shapes in Excel 2016, this time working with multiple shapes as well as icons. Here you will see how to select multiple shapes, duplicate, rotate, align, change stacking order, group/ungroup, and use the selection pane.
episodes.title: Shapes: Multiple Shapes and Icons

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore using SmartArt in Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to use SmartArt to more easily add a graphical element to your spreadsheets by giving you self-adjusting themes, text, and shapes.
episodes.title: Smart Art

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne culminate our graphical element skills in Excel 2016 by creating a birthday invitation. Here you will see how to use page layouts, orientation, formatting text, moving cells, inserting images, grouping images, etc. Then they show you how to create a two-sided invitation, printing, marking paper for orientation, and adjusting element placement for printer adjustment.
episodes.title: Create an Invitation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne will explore shared workbooks in Excel 2016. Here they cover the why and how of sharing workbooks as well as showing you what to expect when working with shared workbooks. They also look at sharing through OneDrive for online collaboration.
episodes.title: Shared Workbooks

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into track changes in Excel 2016. Here they will explain why you would want to enable tracking and how to accomplish that. They also take you through the tracking experience to help you understand how this may benefit you in your working environment.
episodes.title: Track Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore implementing data validation inside of Excel 2016. Here they will show you how to prevent erroneous data types from being entered by restricting the type of data that a user can insert. They also show you how to create custom error messages, highlight invalid data, and protect worksheets with a password.
episodes.title: Data Validation

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne dive into workbook security in Excel 2016. Here they will show you security features like protecting workbooks and worksheets, restrict to editing  certain ranges, mark as final, encrypt file with password, restricting access, and digital signatures.
episodes.title: Workbook Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore working with document properties of an Excel 2016 workbook. Here they will discuss the different properties and metadata as well as demonstrate how to edit and add properties
episodes.title: Document Properties

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how you can customize the Excel 2016 interface to make it more efficient for your workflow. Here you will see how to customize the Ribbon, make custom keyboard shortcuts, and other options in Excel that can be manipulated for ease of use.
episodes.title: Customize Interface
